passages.text: Emerging Europe Europe
Industry 29th European TMT Conference
Date 28 August 2025 Industry Update
Conference Compendium: Telecoms edition
DB TMT Conference, 2025: Telecoms edition

We look forward to welcoming you to our 29th TMT Conference at our offices on the 3rd and 4th of September, 2025. The event will bring together investors and more than 60 corporates from all corners of Telecoms, Media and Technology. We hope that you have a very fruitful two days and we look forward to helping you with your investment decisions.
This compendium will serve as a reference point for the Telecoms space, providing suggested discussion topics.
Robert Grindle, Ph.D. Research Analyst +44- 20- 754- 58490
Keval Khiroya, CFA Research Analyst +44- 20- 754- 18164
Roshan Ranjit, CFA Research Analyst +44- 20- 754- 52908
John Karidis Research Analyst +44- 20- 754- 54610
Vijay Saravanan Research Associate
Ankit Sharma Research Associate
Lars Vom- Cleff Research Analyst +49- 69- 910- 13526
28 August 2025 Telecoms 29th European TMT Conference
Telecoms: Companies attending. Conference presentation schedule (BST)

Question list: Telecoms. 5 1&1 (Buy, TP EUR 29.0) 6 BT Group (Sell, TP GBp 140) 7 Cellnex (Buy, TP EUR 42.5) 8 Deutsche Telekom (Buy, TP EUR 41.0) 9 Eutelsat (Sell, TP EUR 2.00) 10 Freenet AG (Buy, TP EUR 39.0) 11 Helios Towers (Buy, TP GBp 255) 12 OTE Group (Buy, TP EUR 20.0) 13 INWIT (Buy, TP EUR 12.5) 14 Koninklijke KPN NV (Buy, TP EUR 4.45) 15 Liberty Global (Buy, TP USD 22.0) 16 NOS SGPS SA (Hold, TP EUR 4.00) 17 Orange SA (Buy, TP EUR 15.5) 18 Proximus NV (Hold, TP EUR 7.00) 19 SES SA 20 Sunrise GmbH (Buy, CHF 65.0) 21 Telecom Italia (Hold, TP EUR 0.34) 22 Telefonica SA (Sell, TP EUR 3.00) 23 Telenor ASA (Buy, TP NOK 154) 24 Vodafone Group (Buy, TP GBp 135) 25 Zegona Communications (Buy, TP GBp 1,550) 26

CompanyCompany homeTitleDays Attending1&amp;1 AGSascha Q&amp;VidOlivierChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptBT Group plcSimon LowthMathilda WillettChief Financial OfficerInvestor Relations ManagerWeds 3rd SeptCellnex Telecom SAMaria CarrapatoGonzalo Garcia-Carretero MalagonInvestor Relations DirectorInvestor Relations ManagerThurs 4th SeptDeutsche TelekomHannes WittigVP Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptEutelsat Communication SAJean-François FallacherJoanna DarlingtonChief Executive OfficerChief Communications and Investor Relations OfficeWeds 3rd SeptFreenet AGIngo ArnoldTim-Frederik OehrChief Financial OfficerHead of IR &amp; ESG ReportingThurs 4th SeptHelios Towers plcManjit DhillonChris Baker-SamsChief Financial OfficerHead of Strategic Finance and Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptOTE GroupSofia ZiavaInvestor Relations Senior ManagerThurs 4th SeptInfrastructure Wireless Italiane SpA - INWITFabio RuffiniStrategy M&amp;A and IR DirectorThurs 4th SeptKoninklijke KPN NVMatthijs van LeijenhorstHead of Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptLiberty Global LtdMichael BishopLewis ChongVP Investor RelationsDirector Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptNOS SGPS SALuis NascimentoPedro Cota DiasAndre SalvadoChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsInvestor Relations AnalystThurs 4th SeptOrange SALaurent MartinezConstance GestChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptProximus NVMark ReidBart BooneNancy GoossensChief Financial OfficerInvestor Relations ManagerInvestor Relations LeadThurs 4th SeptSES SALisa PatakiChristian KernJoana GomesChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsSpecialist, Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptSunrise GmbHJany FruytierAlex HerrmannChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptTelecom Italia -TIMPietro LabriolaAdrian CalazaPaolo LesboChief Executive OfficerChief Financial OfficerHead of Investor RelationsWeds 3rd SeptTelefonica SATorsten AchtmannManuel NavalonGlobal Director Investor RelationsInvestor RelationsThurs 4th SeptTelenor ASATorbjorn WistFrank MaaøOscar SperreChief Financial OfficerSVP Capital Markets and Investor RelationsInvestor Relations ManagerWeds 3rd SeptVodafone GroupDavid IrishRoy TealGertrud SzaboVictoria GarnhamDeputy Director of Investor RelationsDeputy Director of Investor RelationsSenior Investor Relations ManagerCorporate Access ManagerWeds 3rd SeptZegona CommunicationsMenno KremerAlfonso EnriquezInvestment DirectorHead of Investor RelationsThurs 4th Sept

1&1 (Buy, TP EUR 29.0)- Appreciate this is a decision for United Internet, but do you expect a 1&1 squeeze out and when could that happen?- What are your latest expectations on when you could get access to spectrum through leasing? Does this still need the regulator to get involved to secure it?- You will have c.2k sites at year-end but what does this mean for the amount of traffic you can host on your own network?- How does the site rollout progress beyond this year, and what does this mean for how much traffic you will host on your own network (assuming spectrum leasing)?- How does capex trend beyond this year? When do you envisage a capex peak?- What is the latest on the cartel office's investigation into Vantage? Do you think you will get faster access to sites and will you accelerate your rollout if able?- How do your wholesale costs for 2025 compare to 2024? What percentage of your traffic is now on the Vodafone network versus Telefonica?- How do you expect opex to evolve in 2026 compared to 2025 – if you could talk about the moving parts on wholesale costs, reduced costs on not having to manage a migration and other network costs?- How committed are you to the mobile network rollout and what level of rollout do you see as desirable?- The market has discussed potential German mobile consolidation – could this make sense for you? Do you think the regulator would be open?- How do you see the competitive environment currently in German mobile and broadband?- How do we think about the KPI momentum near-term and beyond?- What has been happening to your German mobile ARPU during this more intense competitive period? Are you finding it harder to extract additional ARPU?- How is your relationship with Rakuten? If you decided to follow a different strategy to network build, what commitments do you then still have both with Rakuten and tower providers?

BT Group (Sell, TP GBp 140)- What is the progress on the restructuring / sale/ JV of Global Services?- Improved Openreach line losses in Q1 26: is this a seasonal effect or a change in alt-net momentum?- BT Consumer has delivered positive broadband net adds for the last two quarters – which brand(s) are behind this push?- Is Equinox 3 fibre wholesale pricing on the agenda for H2 26/ H1 27?- What impact (if any) of Sky wholesaling on CityFibre since July?- How are 'back to school' promotions playing out?- Is Virgin Media's acquisition of Daisy a material factor for BT Business?- Will B2B OTS change the broadband dynamic for SME customers?- BT Consumer recently (from 31 July) raised its in- contract annual price rises to £4 (broadband) and £2.50 (mobile) vs £3 and £1.50 prev. Does this indicate a further focus on value vs volume?- What has been the customer response to EE's range of 'Safter SIMs' designed to meet the changing needs of young mobile areas during secondary school?- When will BT re- commence paying UK taxes? Are higher property rates on the agenda for the upcoming budget?- When will Openreach start deploying XGS- PON and/or launch symmetric services to customers?- Has the market for MVNO business changed since the VodafoneThree merger (CMA requires network capacity to be made available to virtual operators)?- Has the VodafoneThree merger changed the competitive landscape?- Will EE need to bring forward 5G roll- out to maintain network superiority post V3? Will EE need to enter into new agreements for towers/BTS capacity?

S Focus remains on the MSA renewal process and whilst recent renewals have extended maturities and reinforced customer relationships, can you outline the \(1\%\) of group PoPs not contained within an MSA? Whilst there hasn't been an example yet, if a customer was not going to renew an MSA how much notice do they have to give?

S Following MNO consolidation, the UK market is one where you have talked about scope for upside given the want for stronger networks; have you had any commitments or indications of interest from customers? What is your base case assumption for winning the incremental PoPs highlighted by VOD- Three UK?

S Where do you see the most tenancy ratio upside? France has multiple BTS programs and is the growth engine; can you combine these BTS, when can we start seeing synergies here - is this MNO consolidation driven? Is this a driver of the cost optimisation you have mentioned?

S Tenancy ratios in the Netherlands are the highest in the group, is there any upside left here? Is pricing the driver of growth in this market? Do you see scope for further footprint expansion in The Netherlands, is there scope to buy in minorities here, timing? Does KPN buying back towers change the market dynamics?

S How are your discussions going with customers on active RAN sharing? Are there still only near- term developments in Poland? Could this impact your FCF profile given volumes? What is the next market for active sharing?
S What is the average contract length without extensions? What if you include extensions, what are the next big renewals coming up? Any scope to change the caps on your MSAs?

S You have talked about the process of renegotiating land leases as part of the efficiency push, approx what \(1\%\) of your sites are on owned land vs. leases? Is renegotiating on the back burner now given the LandCo's focus on purchases? Also, what is the split of length of land leases, \(10\) years? What is the average land lease length?
S How is the Broadcast business trending? Are the margins in this segment still holding up, or coming under more pressure? Could we see footprint expansion in Broadcast?

S What is the latest with the Swiss disposal? It seems this process is taking longer than the Austria/Ireland sale, apart from the macro environment, what if anything, has changed? S You have been clear on the intention for a progressive shareholder remuneration policy, but does upside remain on the total FY25 shareholder remuneration? S You have previously talked about mid- term consolidation in the wider TowerCo market; has your view on the time frame changed, do you have more conviction in your views?

Deutsche Telekom (Buy, TP EUR 41.0)- Could DT buy T- Mobile US shares directly from Softbank? Can this only be in periods when non participating in the TMUS buyback programme?- Could DT buy Softbank's 21m remaining DT shares (0.4%)?- What has been the response to the recent launch of the AI Phone and AI Tablet across the European markets?- DT has recently been reported to be investing in defence funds managed by T- Capital. Is this a material usage of \(>€15bn\) balance sheet flexibility through to FY27?- Outside of buyback prolongation, what are the potential destinations of DT balance sheet flexibility?- Has B2B activity in Germany picked up in Q3 due to Govt spend and/or Government stimulus programmes?- Can recent broadband net add weakness (- 20k in Q2 vs - 7k in Q1) stabilise/ improve or will the focus on customer value vs volume lead to higher run- rate losses in H2?- Will any of the - €500m cumulative cash tax savings to DE Govt stimulus accrue in FY25? What phasing over FY26- 28?- What is the latest thinking on GD Towers and/or monetisation of other European towers?- What are other potential initiatives to releasing value within DT's cheap ex US stub?- How has the recent (1 July) consolidation of cloud assets under T- Cloud impacted selling of cloud products?- Is varying levels of 'sovereignty' a key customer requirement?

You have previously flagged a slowdown in the FTA channel trend, has any of this growth returned given increasing advertising spend? Are you still seeing 'pockets' of growth in certain Video neighbourhoods, where? Where do you see pricing upside? What is the level of indexation, still c. \(20\%\) Are there any big Video renewals coming up? Are there any signs from your main customers about a 'mid- term' switch off of capacity? Given recent headwinds in the GEO Fixed Broadband segment, has this stabilised? Is LEO consumer broadband growth now starting to offset the GEO declines? It was reported that LEO broadband service will start in South Korea in Sept, any other markets where service will soon start? The outlook for Government growth appears upbeat supported by the LEO pick up, is this driven by one/a few particular contract/s or are you seeing broader demand across Europe? What have you considered for the next US DoD renewal following the \(

S How has the German mobile market performed recently? Is competition still fierce and the trend towards discount tariffs ongoing? S When do you expect your ARPU to rise again and how do you intend to do it? S What impact for your business do you expect from mobile- network operator 1&1 Drillisch's arrival in Germany? S Do you feel comfortable with your pricing points? S We have recently seen a customer shift from pre- paid to post- paid tariffs, improving your business mix (more higher- margin service revenue); how long can this trend continue before it reaches its saturation point? S When can we expect a strategy update from your new CEO? S What do you intend to do with your more than satisfying, stable FCF? External growth? Another share buyback programme? S Is there potential for more industry consolidation in Germany? S Has the churn rate for your customer base changed recently? S Can you elaborate which distribution channels are the most successful for freenet among the proprietary online channels, own shops, third party shops, and Media Markt Saturn? S Your higher- margin TV & Media business is gaining weight. Would there be external growth opportunities to make it grow even faster? S Is waipu.tv developing as expected? S When can we expect the current headwind from O2 Telefonica customers leaving the platform to have ended? S What underlying organic customer growth do you expect for your waipu business short- to medium- term? S What market share do you believe is feasible for waipu.tv? S How is the competitive situation in the German IPTV market? S When do you expect the negative growth of your freenet TV customer base to level- off? S What is the exact value proposition of waipu.tv, i.e. price, no receiver, independence from telco provider etc.? S How do you see M&A potential going forward? S How do you feel you are positioned in terms of ESG considerations?

Helios Towers (Buy, TP GBp 255)- How have geopolitical events in countries like DRC impacted HTWS's growth?- How does HTWS protect itself from typical Emerging Market risks such as volatility in FX rates and local market energy prices?- What is the risk that national governments tax HTWS materially more?- Help us understand the structural tailwind(s) for HTWS?- The 'colocation vs. new built- to- suit towers' of HTWS's tenancy growth was 91%:9% in FY24 and 84%:16% in 1H FY25. What is the risk that HTWS is building too few new towers to keep growing well beyond the next 2- 3 years?- What appetite does HTWS have to acquire more underexploited tower portfolios in the next 3- 5 years?- How interested in HTWS in expanding into leasing active mobile network infrastructure as well (e.g. hardware on towers) and/or datacentres?- What is the risk to HTWS that Mobile Network Operator (MNO) customers merge, or deploy their own towers in some parts of a country?- How does HTWS compare with its MNO customers in terms of average power uptime per tower, and speed to deploy a new tenancy?- What is the risk to HTWS from satellite service providers like Starlink?- At the end of Jul- 25, HTWS reduced the average cost of its debt from 7.2% to 6.9%. How did this happen, and how much lower can this average cost go absent any more credit rating upgrades?- What needs to happen for HTWS's credit rating to be upgraded from its current level?- Why is IHS Holding (IHS US), the other listed African TowerCo, an inappropriate valuation benchmark for HTWS?- What is the remaining share overhang from pre- IPO shareholders?

OTE Group (Buy, TP EUR 20.0)S PPc entered the market in Jun- 25 with very aggressive broadband prices (50%+ cheaper than those of the 3 main providers). What are you hearing about its commercial success so far?S What is the risk to OTE that (very late entrant) PPC compels OTE's main rivals, Nova and Vodafone, to start a price war (which would likely compel OTE to join this war as well)?S What is the risk to OTE (and to Nova and Vodafone) that PPC will bundle its very cheap broadband service with its household energy offering?S OTE plans to deploy FTTP to 2.1m premises in total by YE25 and 3.0m by (sometime in) 2027 (Greece has c.4.8m premises in total). Can OTE deploy FTTP materially faster since PPC entered the market with very aggressive broadband prices and its aerial deployment of FTTP infrastructure is meaningfully faster than that of OTE currently?S ICT revenue growth remains a material tailwind for OTE. What gives you confidence this will continue to be the case for a several years yet?S What scope does OTE Greece have to continue gaining material opex savings for a few more years yet?S Kostas Nebis has been Group CEO for just over 1 year – how does his stewardship differ from that of his predecessor (Michael Tzamaz), and what plans does he have for OTE beyond the near term?S Why does OTE continue to have a significantly underleveraged balance sheet? To what extent is this because DT is OTE's controlling shareholder?S What are the ways in which DT adds value to OTE?S What are the prospects for the Athens Stock Exchange to be upgraded to 'Developed Market' status in the next few months/quarters?

S Whilst there are volume commitments from the anchor customers, progress has been relative slow in the last few quarters - can we expect a more back- end- loaded ramp- up, perhaps H2 25? Or is there an increased mix within the MSA and New Services bucket? S One of your anchor customers has been quite vocal on the 2028 MSA renewal, whilst you have been clear on the all- or- nothing renewal, what (if anything) are the discussion points? S Recent trends have seen have seen weaker OLO net adds, what gives you confidence it will pick up in the coming quarter, or is this the new normal level? Have you got commitments from the third party MNO/FWA providers? S Within the OLOs customers what mix should we expect for MNOs, FWAs and loT? Is there a particular customer driving the OLO growth or is it evenly split? S Can you give us a sense of the New Services pricing, we have seen a ramp up in volumes but what has happened to pricing, do you have to prioritise capacity and therefore is there pricing power? S What upside is there from the higher EM limits in Italy - or has this opportunity now passed given the law was approved more than a year ago? Does this allow a better dialogue with the anchor tenants and Iliad? Could we see more Iliad PoPs on your sites in the coming quarters? S What is the approx. quarterly split between land rent negotiations and land buyouts? Should we expect a portfolio buyout like with the TIM sites two years ago? Have the dynamics as part of the negotiations changed? S Where can there be further efficiencies in the organisation? Is there scope to automate more, or is margin expansion all coming from leases? S Historically, you have had more confidence in your RFC guidance metric; are there any other non- operational levers you can address to drive more efficiencies, how do you manage the wash out of the tax benefit in the coming years?

S What is the latest with your shareholder base, what dialogue have you had with either of your larger shareholders? The BoD changes with new VTWR management members joining is interesting as well as their recent market purchases? S Despite the enhanced shareholder remuneration, you are currently running your balance sheet below the leverage corridor; when can we expect a further decision here, or should we expect a lower leverage going forward? How should we think about the mix of future investment and shareholder returns? S Previous M&A has been bolt- on deals (loT and small cells), is there ambition to look at anything bigger or more material? How do you think about the wider tower eco- system, any opportunities for peripheral assets?

Koninklijke KPN NV (Buy, TP EUR 4.45)- What are your latest thoughts on the Q3 competitive environment and versus Q2? It looks like there has been an increase in the discount period on broadband contracts at least for some players?- Ziggo's price cuts appear to have had little impact on your broadband KPIs in Q2. How do we think about retail and wholesale broadband KPIs beyond Q2?- What are your latest thoughts on the Consumer revenue growth trajectory for H2 and beyond?- Your fibre churn is low but where customers do churn, where do they go? Do any of them go back to cable (if coming from Ziggo)?- What percentage of your retail and wholesale copper customers are in your fibre footprint vs outside of it?- How confident are you that the Glaspoor / DELTA deal gets approved? Do you think there will be any remedies, and what's the latest on timing?- If the Glaspoor / DELTA deal gets approved, would you look to do more deals to buy part of the alt-net footprint? Does it make sense to do these before you finish your FTTH rollout (as an alternative to building)?- Is there room for front book increases in mobile, or are the operators waiting for each other to go first?- How should we think about service revenue and EBITDA growth phasing for the rest of the year?- You have been a bit more vocal on open savings (e.g. headcount reduction). What is the open savings opportunity next year and beyond?- How will your margin profile look in a FTTH world and how long does it take to get there? What is the right level of headcount?- What are your latest thoughts on B2B? Is there much upside from increased defence spending? Are corporates willing to spend?- Your wholesale mobile trends have been strong and how sustainable are these? Do you have any large MVNO contracts up for renewal?- How are you thinking about post FTTH capex beyond 2027?- Anything you can say on what to expect from the 5 November mini strategy update? Should we expect a new FCF target which goes further out?- What do you consider to be the right leverage for KPN going forward and how much capacity do you need to leave for potential Glaspoor consolidation and any other FTTH deals?- What is the latest thinking on the cash returns split on dividends vs. buybacks going forward? Should we expect you to continue to return all FCF to shareholders?

Liberty Global (Buy, TP USD 22.0)- How is integration of Daisy progressing? What is the main source of synergy within the £70m run- rate cost savings by 2030?- Can any of Daisy's 120k BB lines or mobile revenues be migrated to the VMO2 network?- With the VMO2 netco monetisation kicked into the long grass, how can the company achieve all its ambitions for fibre upgrade, connection and wholesale opportunity?- nexfibre build is scaled back to 2.5m (prev target 5m) so are inorganic opportunities one way to make up the network coverage shortfall?- Has broadband net adds momentum improved in Q3 (the company was to develop churn prevention strategies) – is the UK broadband market as fiercely competitive as it was?- Belgian fibre network collaboration deal with Proximus. Market testing is expected in Sep. When will the new agreement be fully operational?- Could LBTY subsequently monetise part of Wyre (Belgian netco)? (i.e. bring on new equity investors and deconsolidate?)- Have Dutch broadband line losses continued to improve in Q3 (green shoots of lower churn in May/Jun)? When will the agreement with Delta to wholesale to 600k new homes become effective?- Liberty Blume made a purchase (August) of an insurance broker. Can we expect to see more M&A to bolster this company? What type of companies are the ~12 external Blume customers outside of LBTY family?- The press has reported on substantial voluntary redundancy programmes. Are these Liberty Services and Corporate or OpCo focussed?- What progress on Dutch towers divestment? Potential timing? Are there other assets in NL that are non- core?- Is the Vodafone Ziggo distribution for FY25 confirmed? (€200- 250m inc ~ €100m shareholder loan)- Formula- E exclusivity recently extended to 2048 + a 5 year extension option. What was the rationale for that given prev. expiry in 2038. What was the cost?

S The competitive environment ramped up during H1 which has impacted your topline; how do you defend against this threat? Should we expect the trend to get tougher into H2? S You recently highlighted that the \(\%\) of gross adds on your challenger brand has ticked higher to c. \(10\%\) , do you think this moves higher in H2? Do you believe you have strong segmentation of your brands to avoid the risk of downspin? S Your price rises have historically been linked to CPI; is there potential for any increase this year amidst the Digi presence? Given you have invested heavily in the network vs. certain peers can you use the quality angle? S Digi's initial push has been in mobile as it continues to build out its fixed network; what potential impact could they have with a converged offering? How is NOS' offer differentiated? S Your B2B segment has been taking share in the SME/Large Corporate market, what has driven this? Can this continue, is it pricing driven? Any softness seen within your Enterprise customer base? S With the acquisition of Claranet, does this change your B2B strategy? What, if any are the product overlaps and where do you believe you can now take share? Can you remind me of the synergies associated with this deal? S Whilst you have said the material cost savings from your efficiency plans have been achieved you continue to extract further savings - is there upside to the original target? When will the new efficiency program start? S Your PPA signed in 2021 has been a material driver of opex savings, c. \(40\%\) of your energy now comes from green energy - can this move up significantly, what further savings could be made? S Last year you announced an extension to your FTTH rollout target (93% from \(86\%\) now) highlighting this will be deployed via a capex light model, how will this be achieved? S What are you views on wholesale partners and offering a national roaming agreement to Digi? Is there potential for an agreement depending on price, could this be mobile only, or in reality would mobile and fixed access be offered? S Digi is guiding to \(50\%\) fibre coverage by year end, are you already seeing competition on the fixed side for fibre subscribers

S Given you are well below your target leverage of c.2x, when can we expect a decision on balance sheet headroom? Will this be deployed to rebase the ordinary DPS? S Are there any ambitions for inorganic growth, domestically or with an international view? S Please can you remind me of the current situation around your shareholder structure and your stake that sits with the Portuguese courts; when will that be released?

S The pricing environment in France continues to evolve driven by peers, you reported strong volumes in Q2, but pricing is under pressure; is there a risk the upselling momentum stalls? You have not implemented a base wide price increase for two years, can we expect more targeted price increases - what \(\%\) of the base? S What \(\%\) of your net adds come from the high end in France? Are you happy to cede share at the low end (SFR red continues to be more aggressive here?), is SOSH winning share? Can you increase pricing at the low end of the market, or will that be tough? S As FTTH roll- out completes, who is making the most inroads with the co- investment model with you? Focus of the roll- out has moved to the PIN areas, this requires a more defensive strategy, how do you prepare? Q2 saw a strong net adds number, how was this achieved given the maturing market? S What gives you confidence in seeing domestic EBITDAaL growth accelerate? Is it more driven by falling wholesale headwinds or are you seeing upside to the efficiencies you are implementing - leaver plan, more Al usage? S The market remains tough in Spain; do you expect it to improve? What early dynamics have you observed as part of the combined group? What drove the raised synergy target? Scope for further upside here? S You have announced a third- party investor in the Spain FibreCo with MasOra holding a \(58\%\) stake; could MasOra sell down further? Do we have to wait for this deal to close before any other strategic action in Spain? S In MEA, you raised the FY25 guidance to again double- digit EBITDAaL growth; which geographies are the drivers here? You have talked about scope for increasing scale in the existing footprint, any developments? Is this focused on bolt- on deals (such as seen in cybersecurity), or is there ambition for bigger deals or even an IPO? S How should we think about the group cost efficiency glide path? Are there further cost efficiencies you can look to extract in France or across your footprint? Are you running ahead of the plan in France, which offsets the Enterprise weakness? How should we think about the operational leverage from price increases? S On the dividend, given the strong FCF development expected over the coming years is it fair to assume upside to the EUR 0.75 floor given the implied c. \(55\%\) pay out ratio? Is there an element of conservatism given the historical c. \(65\%\) payout?

S Orange has said it could play a part in domestic consolidation; how would this work, what type of assets (if any) could you acquire? In the event of consolidation, how do you see the market evolving? S Whilst TOTEM's organic performance continues to be solid, the newsflow around inorganic expansion has gone quiet, is there still interest in Telco infrastructure? S Are there any strategic opportunities left in your footprint? A few years ago, there were reports (Bloomberg) around the MEA unit, and more recent reports suggest new licenses in the region?

Your revised Consumer product offering has delivered good traction in recent months, what is the main differentiator vs. peers, is network quality playing a factor? Your KPI momentum has been maintained despite ongoing price increases, how have you been able to manage that process? Any signs of elevated churn, or below the line promotions? Can you see your customer volume momentum continuing in the coming quarters, and are you maintaining strong brand segmentation?

Whilst Digi's momentum has stalled in recent months, do you expect/have seen a renewed push under their new management? One of your peers removed one low- end offering from the market, could you do similar on one of the challenger brands?

Is there scope for some more for more price increases in the market given the robust volumes? You have introduced some speed based tiering within the Mobile Vikings brand, could this broaden across the portfolio?
How is the network preparation going to host the Digi traffic? Can you remind me when this will be complete? Any scope to extend this wholesale agreement on to the fixed network?

You upgraded your domestic guidance in July after the strong H1 delivery and the increased FY target implies a broadly steady H2 (vs. H1), other than the Digi uncertainty are there any other factors to consider?
Are there any further efficiency plans you could deploy to support your domestic EBITDA trends?

The integration of the International segments has faced headwinds both at the industry level and operational level, how confident are you that this can be addressed in the near term? The product mix will have to adapt to the current customer demand, how are you positioned here?
Whilst we are waiting for the announcement of new management at the Global segment, what can you say on the synergy target initially announced?

Do you think the International segment now has the appropriate scale to drive the return you are looking for? Previously, product and geographical breadth was cited as areas of investment have you achieved these goals with Route Mobile, or do you continue to look for scale?
Underlying FCF generation remains under pressure; are there any nonoperational levers you can utilise to improve the situation? Working Capital has been a drag; when can this reverse?

We continue to wait on the finalisation of your co- investment framework with Fluvius; are we still on track for end Q3? You have been clear the regulator has been monitoring the ongoing developments so this should result in a smooth approval process?

Would you entertain the opportunity to work with Orange Belgium/VOO on a potential FTTH build in the South? Are the dynamics of a fibre build project very different in the North of the country vs. the South?
You increased the cash proceeds target from asset disposals; how was this achieved, more volumes, or expectations of higher funds?

SES SAOperational- Underlying Media trends have stabilised in recent quarters; have we now gone through the big volume step change and will we continue to see mid single digit revenue declines?- What is the geographic mix of your Media revenues, is it reflective of your group geographic mix? Which geographies (if any) are seeing pockets of Media growth? Is there indexation embedded into your contracts?- The Government segment continues to get a lot of attention, which geographies are driving the most interest? Is the interest mostly in MEO capacity or does GEO still have a part to play in Government?- There have been reports (Bloomberg) that certain Governments want to run parallel satellite networks; how does this fit with your Government customer base?- How long are Government contracts? Do they typically come with extension options? Are you seeing more competition in this segment?- Does the completed Intelsat deal now give you a greater presence in the US market, what is the new exposure to the US Government market now?- In Mobility, your focus has appeared to be more in Maritime, is that just a function of the contract wins, or a strategic push? You have a partnership agreement with Starlink, can this be migrated into the Aviation segment?- Within the Networks business Fixed data is the vertical facing the most headwinds given structural changes, can this segment grow and if so how?- Given deal completion, which segments will be the focus areas? Which verticals will benefit from the Intelsat scale?

Sunrise GmbH (Buy, CHF 65.0)- What is the state of the Swiss fixed and mobile markets in Q3?- What are the drivers of further top line and EBITDAal growth in H2 25?- What is the magnitude of the costs saving from prolongation of National Hockey rights from 2027/28 season?- Are eventual savings (end 2026) from Nasdaq de- listing and SEC deregistration material?- Sunrise recently commenced selling health and cyber insurance. Volumes are said to be low so far. Is the opportunity more about replacing established 12 month travel insurance (ie when current contracts end) or for ad hoc travel requirements?- Could Sunrise enter into any other adjacent markets (e.g. electricity supply?)- The recent share purchase programme saw employees investing CHF 10m in SUNN shares via salary sacrifice. What is the phasing of any subsequent benefit to EBITDAal?- What is the source of falling lease costs to drive increased margin/bottom line momentum?- 5G SA launch is said to provide substantial network quality improvements for users. Does Sunrise think it can monetise the technology to B2C and B2B customers in the near/medium- term?- Could Sunrise consider paying an interim rather than a full year bullet dividend?- What are the initiatives to drive the B2B opportunity? Has Swisscom's launch of Beam impacted the potential growth of this segment?

Telecom Italia (Hold, TP EUR 0.34)- The market has been quite hopeful of potential in- market consolidation in Italy. Is consolidation likely and do you expect to be an active participant in a deal?- You have talked about consolidation either at the operator or network level. Can you elaborate on what form of network consolidation you could potentially have in Italy?- How should we think about the potential benefits from collaboration with Poste. When do you expect to provide further detail on these benefits and when should they impact financials?- What are your latest expectations for when we should expect to hear the outcome on the licence fee dispute? How do you intend to use the proceeds?- Your leverage is low, even more so if you get to keep the licence fee proceeds. What do you consider to be appropriate leverage for TI and how should we think about uses of cash?- You have previously highlighted a desire to simplify the two classes of shares. When could you take action on the savings shares?- The mobile market has seen reduced portability and you have taken a number of price up actions this year. How do this year's price rises compare to last year?- Is there any upside to your original assumption of flattish revenues in Consumer and if so, what's driving that?- Next year will see the loss of Fastweb MVNO revenues and the gain of Poste MVNO revenues. What does this mean for the wholesale revenue trend in 2026 and 2027?- This year's domestic EBITDAal performance is meant to be more back-end loaded. What explains this?- You've highlighted the opportunity from the current focus on cloud sovereignty and security. What does this mean for your Enterprise growth prospects? Do you expect cloud growth to accelerate?- You have flagged potential upside to your 2025 FCF guidance; what is driving that and do you see potential upside to your targets beyond?- Can you talk about opex – what does not having to manage the network and hopefully a calmer retail environment mean for your opex? Are there any areas where you see incremental scope for opex reduction and if so, where?- You previously spoke about potential interest in acquiring small assets in Enterprise – does this make sense and what type of assets could you buy?- Brazil appears to be performing well – should we see the current momentum as sustainable? Are you happy with the current stake?- Do you have any appetite to buy-in the minorities in Brazil, or are you happy for your stake to just increase through TIM Brasil carrying out a buyback (TI not taking part)?

Can you say any more on the timing of the potential strategic review; press has written November and is that a fair indication of when it should happen? Anything you can say on stories of a potential capital increase? How important is the dividend to each of your core shareholders? You've highlighted the credit rating is important but that also exiting HISPAM has led to an improvement in the quality of your FCF. What is the remaining headroom on your balance sheet, before you face issues with the credit rating? You've clearly been vocal on wanting the regulatory backdrop to be more accommodating to allow deals. Do you feel you're able to put forward deals or do you still need further signs that the regulatory backdrop has improved first? The UK NetCo deal stopped and what was the main issue with the previous plan to find a financial partner? You've talked about wanting to be bigger - would buying out LBTYA in VMO2 make you bigger, or is that just going from \(50\%\) to \(100\%\) in an existing asset? Would any purchase of Zegona be definitely reviewed at the European level or could it be reviewed locally? Do you think consolidation down to two mobile networks plus Digi would be allowed? You said you are happy with your organic strategy in Germany but that you have a responsibility to look at deals too. Could you therefore actively pursue a deal with 1&1 or does your history make it tricky? There had previously been press comment on you buying Minsait. How should we think about your M&A focus in terms of telco vs. non telco assets? What role does Telefonica have to play in the Tech sector and what does that mean from a M&A perspective and on ongoing financials (growth vs. upfront capex spend)? Telefonica is one of the most efficient on capital intensity, with low capex/ sales. Do you feel this is the right place to be or do you think there is room to invest more? Do you think the \(10\%\) annual FCF growth target (as per previous mid-term plan) is also valid going forward? What are the main drivers? The Spanish business has been delivering on revenue growth but the historic EBITDA trajectory has been weaker. How are you thinking about Spanish margins going forward? The headcount reduction benefits finished in Q2. Is there room for further headcount reduction? You want to keep EBITDA broadly stable for Germany in 2025 versus the decline in H1. Do you still expect broadly stable and what will drive that given the H1 decline? How do we think about the drag on H2 EBITDA from the 1&1 wholesale loss versus the drag in H1? Your German OpFCF margins are approximately half the level in Spain. How concerned are you with the current, low FCF generation. What will drive improvements? You have highlighted that Vodafone is the natural spectrum leasing partner for 1&1. Are there any circumstances under which you would be more open to leasing spectrum?

S As a new management team, what do you see as the biggest opportunities and risks for Telenor? S Anything you can say about the format of CMD? Will you give new mid- term guidance, and will it be of a similar format to previous? S Many operators are now quite vocal on the desire for consolidation, and you've indicated willingness on Sweden and Denmark. How do you think about the timing of a potential deal? Would you be willing to be the first to 'test' the EC or would you prefer another market to try first? S Tele2 has said they would push for you to dispose of second brands in Sweden as a remedy. What are your thoughts on this, and how do you think about the risk of remedies from a deal more broadly? Do you think the Swedish regulator is open to network consolidation? S How do we think about the future of the Asian assets? You've talked about potentially finding a solution but what type of solutions could you envisage? How do we think about timing of potential action in Asia? S What are your thoughts on your Bangladesh exposure? Hopefully we've been through the worst on macro and politics, but this is still a volatile asset and accounting for c. one third of your EFC. S You are paying out \(100\%\) of EFC as a dividend currently. Are you happy with this, and do you see room for DPS growth? Some operators are now doing buybacks; do you feel that should be part of your shareholder remuneration? S What do you think is the right leverage level for Telenor? Would you consider higher leverage for a while to accommodate M&A? S Is there much room for buying other Nordic fixed assets in Norway or elsewhere in the region? S What are your latest views on the ownership of infrastructure? Some operators are shifting to ownership rather than divestment of infrastructure and how do you think about the merits or not of selling stakes in your infrastructure assets? S Appreciate your upcoming CMD will cover this but can you talk a bit about how you view Telenor's opex and capex trajectory from here? You've said we have passed the capex peak, so should capex continue to fall? S You have said there are some areas where you could invest more - what areas are these? S You have now shifted to FTTH which unlocked savings from the migration away from copper. Are these savings fully realised or do you still see room for cost- cutting potential in Norway? S You delivered impressive EBITDA growth in Q2. How much of this is phasing vs. the underlying assets doing better than you expected? S How has the competitive environment across your main markets evolved in Q3? Any step changes versus Q2? S Several operators have identified increased defence spending as a benefit to their B2B trends. How do you think about the impact and can you help quantify the benefit at all? S How should we think about 2025 working capital? And how do we think about working capital beyond as you have highlighted potential structural benefits to working cap too.

Vodafone Group (Buy, TP GBp 135)- How have OpCos traded during the summer? How is 'back- to- school' commercial activity in the main markets?- What are the early successes/learnings from the Vodafone Three merger?- Does V3 see an opportunity to sell more broadband across the Three customer base? Would VOD use other alt- nets alongside CityFibre and Community Fibre?- Does VMO2's acquisition of Daisy move the needle with regards Vodafone's B2B intentions in the UK?- How have 1&1 customer migrations progressed in Germany so far in Q2?- Has the competitive environment in German mobile/ fixed improved, deteriorated or stabilised since Q1?- It seems increasingly likely that VOD will receive €900m delayed proceeds from Zegona. This follows €1.3bn from the sale of Oak Holdings last autumn and a residual unallocated proceeds from the sale of Spain/Italy. What are the prospects for more capital returns to shareholders via extension of the current buyback programme and/or dividend growth?- Progress on OXX fibre build scale- up in DE? (i.e progress to beyond 100k HHs per quarter)- Is winning 'data sovereignty' contracts a challenge vs the incumbent in each market?- The Kenyan Govt appears keen to split Safaricom into 3 parts: telco, payments and towers. Is this an opportunity to own more of the telco asset (Vodacom owns 35% and Vodafone 5%) and/or facilitate monetisation of payments/towers?- Vodafone's Q1 call referred to up- skilling acquisitions? In what areas are skills lacking?

S The Spanish press has reported on a potential deal with Telefonica. What are your thoughts on further in- market consolidation in Spain? Do you think there would be regulatory challenges to a potential deal? S What are your latest expectations on the timing for the deal to sell a stake in the MasOrange FibreCo to close, and for the financial partner in the Telefonica FibreCo to be announced? S When could you settle the Vodafone preference shares? Could that happen this calendar year or more likely next? S Are you happy with your current level of financial disclosure? Do you see any benefits of providing more disclosure, and could this change? S Your FCF momentum and FibreCo proceeds mean your leverage falls quickly. How do we think about cash returns and leverage beyond? S You delivered >EUR 200m of OpFCF growth in FY 2025. How do we think about the FCF growth prospects beyond (including FibreCo impacts)? S FY 2025 saw a material reduction in capex spend. What were the main areas of capex reduction, and how do you see capex going forward? S What are the main drivers of opex reduction in FY 2026? What scope is there to cut opex beyond and what are the main areas in 2027 and 2028? S How do you think about the competitive environment in Spain? How do you see the competition from Digi and the low- end more generally? S Last year you cut prices on the Vodafone main brand. What was the impact of these price cuts and has this not created issues with back book repricing? S What percentage of your subscribers are on Lowi? How does growth in the Lowi subscriber base compare to the Vodafone base? S What prompted the decision to remove the Fibra Fit offers on Lowi? Was it purely due to the fact that you now incur a FTTH wholesale fee or anything beyond? S You have returned to positive broadband subscriber growth; do you see this as sustainable even without the Fibra Fit offers? S What does the end to the cable network mean for capex and opex savings? S Last year you cut headcount and should we expect further headcount reduction and if so, when? S You have talked about opportunities in B2B and Wholesale – what do these mean for your business and when? S How much visibility do you have on revenues and when do you expect revenues to stabilise? S How different is Vodafone back book ARPU versus the latest front book? S Your interest costs should fall due to the FibreCo proceeds but are there any further opportunities to refinance debt? S Is there more you could do on mobile infrastructure with further sharing? When could this happen? S You have been pushing for a reduction in mobile spectrum fees – has there been any further movement on this topic? S Anything you can say on the level of dividend proceeds we should expect from the FibreCos?

The Equity Rating Dispersion Chart depicts the following:

The proportion of recommendations that are rated "buy", "sell" and "hold" over the previous 12 months. This is shown for securities issued in the stated region e.g. "Europe Universe". See rating definitions below. This is represented by the "Companies Covered" bars in the chart. The percentage value displayed above the bar is the proportion as a percentage. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "buy" / "Companies Covered" bar means that \(50\%\) of DB's equity research covered companies over the past 12 months have a "buy" rating.
Next to each of the three respective bars showing the proportion of "buy", "sell" and "hold" recommendations we provide two additional bars to show:

- The proportion of "buy", "sell" or "hold recommendations where Deutsche Bank and or/Affiliates provided MIFID Investment or Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. This is represented in the "MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the given rating where DB has also provided MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "Cos. w/ MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar means \(50\%\) of the Companies Covered with the rating stated have also received MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services from DB.

- The proportion of "buy" (or "sell" or "hold) recommendations where Deutsche Bank and or/Affiliates has provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months for which it has received compensation. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the stated rating where DB has also provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months. E.g. \(50\%\) above the "Cos. w/ Investment Banking relationship" bar means \(50\%\) of the Companies Covered with the rating stated also have an Investment Banking Relationship with DB.
Buy: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors buy the stock.
Sell: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors sell the stock.
Hold: We take a neutral view on the stock 12- months out and, based on this time horizon, do not recommend either a Buy or Sell.
\(\mathsf{TSR} =\) Total Shareholder Return. Percentage change in share price from current price to projected target price plus projected dividend yield

Macroeconomic fluctuations often account for most of the risks associated with exposures to instruments that promise to pay fixed or variable interest rates. For an investor who is long fixed- rate instruments (thus receiving these cash flows), increases in interest rates naturally lift the discount factors applied to the expected cash flows and thus cause a loss. The longer the maturity of a certain cash flow and the higher the move in the discount factor, the higher will be the loss. Upside surprises in inflation, fiscal funding needs, and FX depreciation rates are among the most common adverse macroeconomic shocks to receivers. But counterparty exposure, issuer creditworthiness, client segmentation, regulation (including changes in assets holding limits for different types of investors), changes in tax policies, currency convertibility (which may constrain currency conversion, repatriation of profits and/or liquidation of positions), and settlement issues related to local clearing houses are also important risk factors. The sensitivity of fixed- income instruments to macroeconomic shocks may be mitigated by indexing the contracted cash flows to inflation, to FX depreciation, or to specified interest rates - these are common in emerging markets. The index fixings may - by construction - lag or mis- measure the actual move in the underlying variables they are intended to track. The choice of the proper fixing (or metric) is particularly important in swaps markets, where floating coupon rates (i.e., coupons indexed to a typically short- dated interest rate reference index) are exchanged for fixed coupons. Funding in a currency that differs from the currency in which coupons are denominated carries FX risk. Options on swaps (swaptions) the risks typical to options in addition to the risks related to rates movements.

As a result of the high degree of leverage obtainable in futures and options trading, losses may be incurred that are greater than the amount of funds initially deposited - up to theoretically unlimited losses. Investors in securities such as ADRs, whose values are affected by the currency of an underlying security, effectively assume currency risk.

Australia and New Zealand: This research is intended only for 'wholesale clients' within the meaning of the Australian Corporations Act and New Zealand Financial Advisors Act, respectively. Please refer to Australia- specific research disclosures and related information at https://www.dbresearch.com/PROD/RPS_EN- PROD/PROD0000000000521304.xhtml. Where research refers to any particular financial product recipients of the research should consider any product disclosure statement,

prospectus or other applicable disclosure document before making any decision about whether to acquire the product. In preparing this report, the primary analyst or an individual who assisted in the preparation of this report has likely been in contact with the company that is the subject of this research for confirmation/clarification of data, facts, statements, permission to use company- sourced material in the report, and/or site- visit attendance. Without prior approval from Research Management, analysts may not accept from current or potential Banking clients the costs of travel, accommodations, or other expenses incurred by analysts attending site visits, conferences, social events, and the like. Similarly, without prior approval from Research Management and Anti- Bribery and Corruption ("ABC") team, analysts may not accept perks or other items of value for their personal use from issuers they cover.

Additional information relative to securities, other financial products or issuers discussed in this report is available upon request. This report may not be reproduced, distributed or published without Deutsche Bank's prior written consent.

Backtested, hypothetical or simulated performance results have inherent limitations. Unlike an actual performance record based on trading actual client portfolios, simulated results are achieved by means of the retroactive application of a backtested model itself designed with the benefit of hindsight. Taking into account historical events the backtesting of performance also differs from actual account performance because an actual investment strategy may be adjusted any time, for any reason, including a response to material, economic or market factors. The backtested performance includes hypothetical results that do not reflect the reinvestment of dividends and other earnings or the deduction of advisory fees, brokerage or other commissions, and any other expenses that a client would have paid or actually paid. No representation is made that any trading strategy or account will or is likely to achieve profits or losses similar to those shown. Alternative modeling techniques or assumptions might produce significantly different results and prove to be more appropriate. Past hypothetical backtest results are neither an indicator nor guarantee of future returns. Actual results will vary, perhaps materially, from the analysis.

The method for computing individual E,S,G and composite ESG scores set forth herein is a novel method developed by the Research department within Deutsche Bank AG, computed using a systematic approach without human intervention. Different data providers, market sectors and geographies approach ESG analysis and incorporate the findings in a variety of ways. As such, the ESG scores referred to herein may differ from equivalent ratings developed and implemented by other ESG data providers in the market and may also differ from equivalent ratings developed and implemented by other divisions within the Deutsche Bank Group. Such ESG scores also differ from other ratings and rankings that have historically been applied in research reports published by Deutsche Bank AG. Further, such ESG scores do not represent a formal or official view of Deutsche Bank AG. It should be noted that the decision to incorporate ESG factors into any investment strategy may inhibit the ability to participate in certain investment opportunities that otherwise would be consistent with your investment objective and other principal investment strategies. The returns on a portfolio consisting primarily of sustainable investments may be lower or higher than portfolios where ESG factors, exclusions, or other sustainability issues are not considered, and the investment opportunities available to such portfolios may differ. Companies may not necessarily meet high performance standards on all aspects of ESG or sustainable investing issues; there is also no guarantee that any company will meet expectations in connection with corporate responsibility, sustainability, and/or impact performance.
